messageBody:
Maybe I don't get this. This appears to be abuse of junit.

To me it seems extremely unlikely that you truly require one million tests.
Without knowing further details about your project, I can't offer any
specific ideas about where you've gone wrong, but have you considered
putting the iterator inside the test?

-----Original Message-----
From: Bauduin Raphael [mailto:raphael.bauduin@...]
Sent: Wednesday, February 04, 2004 1:30 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] database migration: tests organisation


On Wed, Feb 04, 2004 at 12:22:17PM -0500, J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
>
> Bauduin Raphael wrote:
>
> > On Mon, Feb 02, 2004 at 01:24:59PM -0500, J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
> > >
> > > Bauduin Raphael wrote:
> > >
> > > <snip />
> > > > My question about the organisation of the tests is that I feel like
all
> > > > tests are first added to the suite, and are run only after all
tests
> > > > have been added. Am I wrong on that?
> > >
> > > No: you are correct. First, JUnit adds all the tests, then executes
them.
> > >
> >
> > Would there be a way to test the customers 100 by 100, freeing the
memory
> > each time?
>
> You would have to build a test suite, execute it, then build another,
> then execute that one.

As there is no junit infrastructure, I started with a solution as
follows:

My main method looks like:


int maxId = 100;
while (maxId < 9000)
{
junit.textui.TestRunner.run(suite(maxId));
maxId += 100;
HibernateConnections.session.clear();
HibernateConnections.sessionPg.clear();

}

my suite method looks like:

TestSuite suite= new TestSuite();
suite.addTest(CustomersTest.suite(maxId));
return suite;

And my CustomersTest.suite(int maxId) looks like:

Iterator iterator = session.iterate("from Customer where
customerid < "+maxId + "and customerid > " + (maxId-100));
int i = 0;
custdb.hibernate.Customer customerPg;
while (iterator.hasNext())
{
customerSuite.addTest(....)
}


This way I effectively get the tests executed completely separated.
What I'll look for now is that all results are put in the same object.
Now, after 100 customers have been tested, I get the report printed. I'd
like to
get it after all tests have passed (when getting out of the
while(maxId<9000)).


I'll post if I find the solution, but help is welcome on that problem ;-)

Raph
